events.event_name: Banco de México’s decision to hold the policy rate
events.description: Banco de México decided to hold the policy rate at 7.00%.

facts.fact_text: The Mexican peso retreated past 17.40 per US dollar.

evidences.evidence_text: The Mexican peso retreated past 17.40 per US dollar giving back part of its recent gains, as markets digested Banco de México’s decision to hold the policy rate at 7.00% and signal greater caution on future easing.

facts.fact_text: Banco de México held the policy rate at 7.00%.

evidences.evidence_text: as markets digested Banco de México’s decision to hold the policy rate at 7.00% and signal greater caution on future easing.

facts.fact_text: Banco de México revised its inflation path higher through 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: Banxico acknowledged firmer inflation risks, revised its inflation path higher through 2026, and emphasised graduality, reinforcing expectations that real yield support will narrow only slowly rather than remain firmly anchored.

claims.claim_text: The peso remained vulnerable to external pressure.

evidences.evidence_text: While the central bank’s pause limited downside by discouraging near term rate cut bets, the peso remained vulnerable to external pressure as a firmer US dollar and elevated US yields continued to raise the opportunity cost of peso exposure.

claims.claim_text: Evidence that growth remains modest despite a Q4 rebound and lingering trade related uncertainty capped upside, encouraging profit taking after January’s strong appreciation.

evidences.evidence_text: Domestically, evidence that growth remains modest despite a Q4 rebound and lingering trade related uncertainty capped upside, encouraging profit taking after January’s strong appreciation.

links.source_ref: Banco de México’s decision to hold the policy rate

evidence.evidence_text: as markets digested Banco de México’s decision to hold the policy rate at 7.00% and signal greater caution on future easing.

Banxico acknowledged firmer inflation risks, revised its inflation path higher through 2026, and emphasised graduality, reinforcing expectations that real yield support will narrow only slowly rather than remain firmly anchored.

links.source_ref: firmer US dollar and elevated US yields

evidence.evidence_text: While the central bank’s pause limited downside by discouraging near term rate cut bets, the peso remained vulnerable to external pressure as a firmer US dollar and elevated US yields continued to raise the opportunity cost of peso exposure.
Domestically, evidence that growth remains modest despite a Q4 rebound and lingering trade related uncertainty capped upside, encouraging profit taking after January’s strong appreciation.
